weka.core.converters.cassandra
Class CassandraColumnMetaData

java.lang.Object
  weka.core.converters.cassandra.CassandraColumnMetaData

public class CassandraColumnMetaData
extends java.lang.Object

Class that encapsulates meta data on a cassandra column family. Also has some utility routines for various bits and pieces related to column families.

Version:
$Revision: 48815 $
Author:
Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

updateIndexedMeta

public void updateIndexedMeta(java.lang.String newIndexedInfo)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Update the encapsulated indexed meta data with user-supplied legal values for string attributes. Note that this does not change the column family meta data stored by cassandra, only the data encapsulated in this class.

Parameters:
newIndexedInfo - a string in attName1:{legalVal1, legalVal2,...};attName2:{... format
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs.

getCassandraTypeForAttribute

public static java.lang.String getCassandraTypeForAttribute(Attribute a)
Return the Cassandra column type (internal cassandra class name relative to org.apache.cassandra.db.marshal) for the given Weka attribute.

Parameters:
a - the Attribute
Returns:
the corresponding internal cassandra type.

getCQLTypeForAttribute

public static java.lang.String getCQLTypeForAttribute(Attribute a)
Return the Cassandra CQL column/key type for the given Weka attribute. We use this type for CQL create column family statements since, for some reason, the internal type isn't recognized for the key. Internal types *are* recognized for column definitions. The CQL reference guide states that fully qualified (or relative to org.apache.cassandra.db.marshal) class names can be used instead of CQL types - however, using these when defining the key type always results in BytesType getting set for the key for some reason.

Parameters:
a - the Attribute
Returns:
the corresponding CQL type

java.lang.Exception

getAttributeTypeForKey

public Attribute getAttributeTypeForKey()
Get the Weka attribute type that corresponds to the type of the key for this column family.

Returns:
the key's type

getAttributeTypeForColumm

public Attribute getAttributeTypeForColumm(java.lang.String colName)
Get the Weka attribute type that corresponds to the type of the supplied cassandra column. Note that there is no Cassandra column type that corresponds to a relational attribute. Relational values are stored as base 64 encoded compressed serialized Instances objects. The header instances for each relational column are stored in the comment field of the column family. The string "@@relational-start@@" denotes the start of a list of relational header definitions, and the string "@@relational-end@@" denotes the end. Between these delimiters are header definitions separated by "@@@". Each definition is

@@header@@

Parameters:
colName - the name of the column to get a ValueMeta for
Returns:
the Weka attribute type appropriate for the type of the supplied column.

public java.util.List<Attribute> getAttributeTypesForSchema()

getColumnFamilyNameFromCQLSelectQuery

Parameters:
subQ - the query with vars substituted
Returns:
the column family name or null if the query is malformed

createColumnFamily

public static boolean createColumnFamily(CassandraConnection conn,
                                         java.lang.String colFamilyName,
                                         Instances structure,
                                         int keyIndex,
                                         boolean compressCQL)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

updateCassandraMeta

public static void updateCassandraMeta(CassandraConnection conn,
                                       java.lang.String colFamilyName,
                                       Instances structure,
                                       int keyIndex,
                                       CassandraColumnMetaData cassandraMeta)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Updates the schema information for a given column family with any fields in the supplied Instances structure that aren't defined in the schema. Abuses the schema "comment" field to store information on any nominal and relational values that might be in the Instances structure.

Parameters:
conn - the connection to use
colFamilyName - the name of the column family to update
structure - the Instances structure containing (potentially) new fields
keyIndex - the index of the key field in the row meta
cassandraMeta - meta data for the cassandra column family
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs updating the schema

                                        java.lang.String columnFamily)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
